result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela Ann Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court WAIVED all costs, fees, and surcharges due to the defendant's inability to pay.
Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds.

Consecutive to: consecutive to 07CF5850.
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pamela Ann Cook

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pamela Ann Cook in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Pamela Ann Cook in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if she is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, she could be deported, excluded from admission to her country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing on Friday, July 10, 2015 at 8:30 AM in BR 25, SB Rm 620 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Pamela Ann Cook not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp. 
Case set for scheduling conference. Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont is the attorney of record in this matter. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela Ann Cook in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Pamela Ann Cook in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  (Date scheduled when both parties would be available.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Pamela Ann Cook in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Pamela Ann Cook in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
